snippet: Kim Ryen-hi, a 45-year-old dressmaker from North Korea, says that her defection to South Korea four years ago was a terrible mistake, and that she has been trying to return to be with her family.
abstract: Profile of Kim Ryen-hi, woman who fears she will never be able to return to North Korea and her family in Pyongyang after defecting to South Korea in 2011; says she intended only to work temporarily in South to earn money for medical procedure but became locked in process that led to defection; officials say there is no reverse process and experts contend Kim's only hope is deal between two governments.
lead_paragraph: Kim Ryen-hi, a 45-year-old dressmaker from North Korea, says that her defection to South Korea four years ago was a terrible mistake, and that she has been trying to return to be with her family.
